  • Method Details

    • getNativeElement

      Object getNativeElement()

    • toJsonString

      default String toJsonString()
      Returns a serialized JSON string representing this value.

    • toJsonString

      static String toJsonString(ReadOnlyJsonObject json)
      Make a JSON text of a JsonObject. For compactness, no whitespace is added. If this would not result in a syntactically correct JSON text, then null will be returned instead.

      Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclic.

      Returns:
      a printable, displayable, portable, transmittable representation of the object, beginning with { (left brace) and ending with } (right brace).

    • appendJsonObject

      static StringBuilder appendJsonObject(ReadOnlyJsonObject json, StringBuilder sb)

    • toJsonString

      static String toJsonString(ReadOnlyJsonArray ca)

    • appendJsonArray

      static StringBuilder appendJsonArray(ReadOnlyJsonArray ca, StringBuilder sb)

    • join

      static StringBuilder join(ReadOnlyJsonArray ca, String separator, StringBuilder sb)
      Make a string from the contents of this JSONArray. The separator string is inserted between each element. Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.
      Parameters:
      separator - A string that will be inserted between the elements.
      Returns:
      a string.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the array contains an invalid number.

    • appendNativeElement

      static StringBuilder appendNativeElement(Object element, NativeJsonWrapper parent, StringBuilder sb)
      Make a JSON text of an Object element. If the object has an element.toJSONString() method, then that method will be used to produce the JSON text. The method is required to produce a strictly conforming text. If the object does not contain a toJSONString method (which is the most common case), then a text will be produced by the rules.

      Warning: This method assumes that the data structure is acyclical.

      Parameters:
      element - The element to be serialized.
      Returns:
      a printable, displayable, transmittable representation of the object, beginning with { (left brace) and ending with } (right brace).
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the element is or contains an invalid number.

    • trimNumber

      static String trimNumber(String s)
      Shave off trailing zeros and decimal point, if possible.

    • numberToString

      static String numberToString(Object n) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Produce a string from a Number.
      Parameters:
      n - A Number
      Returns:
      A String.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If n is a non-finite number.

    • testValidity

      static void testValidity(Object o) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Throw an exception if the object is an NaN or infinite number.
      Parameters:
      o - The object to test.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If o is a non-finite number.

    • appendQuoted

      static StringBuilder appendQuoted(String string, StringBuilder sb)
      Produce a string in double quotes with backslash sequences in all the right places. A backslash will be inserted within HTML tags, allowing JSON text to be delivered in HTML. In JSON text, a string cannot contain a control character or an unescaped quote or backslash.
      Parameters:
      string - A String
      Returns:
      A String correctly formatted for insertion in a JSON text.
